title: ‘Millionaire Yang’ Was China’s First Stock-Trading Hero
sub_head: Yang Huaiding started trading bonds and stocks at the dawn of the country’s financial-markets experiments, before it had real exchanges
body:
“Millionaire Yang” embodied Chinese leader Deng Xiaoping’s mantra “To get rich is glorious.”
A steelworker-turned-winning-investor whose real name was Yang Huaiding, he became a folk hero with his stock trading at the dawn of China’s financial-market experiments in the late 1980s.
Millionaire Yang, as he was widely known, died June 13 in Shanghai, official media outlets in China reported.
He was 70 years old, according to the birth date given in his 2002 autobiography, “How to Be a Millionaire,” which said he grew up poor in a large Shanghai family. His father once worked in the local tax bureau while his mother did social work.
China’s state-controlled news agency, Xinhua, quoted a son, Yang Yuqi, saying Mr. Yang had been hospitalized for complications related to diabetes.
